block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
COMEDY
Oradell ''Mission Improv-able Returns (MI2),'' improvisational comedy; a Second Stage production. Through Jan. 28. $10. Bergen County Players, 298 Kinderkamack Road. (201) 261-4200.
FILM

Bloomfield ''Only Human,'' directed by Dominic Harari and Teresa Pelegri; in Spanish with English subtitles. Feb. 4 at 3 p.m. Free. Temple Ner Tamid, 939 Broad Street. (973) 338-1500. Hamilton Groundhog Day celebration, with drinks, food and a screening of ''Groundhog Day,'' with Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell. Friday at 5:30 p.m. $35. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Morristown ''Aspects of Love,'' film series: ''Two for the Road,'' directed by Stanley Donen. Thursday at 6:30 p.m. Free. The Morristown & Morris Township Library, 1 Miller Road. (973) 538-6161. New Brunswick The New Jersey Film Festival, Spring 2007. Schedule and information: njfilmfest.com. Through April 15. $4 to $10. New Jersey Media Arts Center, 72 Lipman Drive. (732) 932-8482. Princeton Environmental film festival, with screenings and lectures. Schedule and information: princetonlibrary.org/peff. Wednesday through Feb. 4. Free. Princeton Public Library, 65 Witherspoon Street. (609) 924-9529. Teaneck ''Sophie Scholl: The Final Days,'' directed by Marc Rothemund; in German with English subtitles. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $5. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923. West Orange Annual festival of classic films, including ''Lawrence of Arabia,'' ''Rear Window'' and ''Casablanca''; some of the screenings are followed by discussions. Schedule and information: westorangeartscouncil.org. Through March 15. $6 and $7. AMC Theater, Essex Green Shopping Center, (973) 324-9100.
FOR CHILDREN

Hamilton Groundhog Day celebration, with tours, workshops, food and storytelling. Ages 3 to 10. Friday, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. $3; registration required. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Red Bank ''Hansel and Gretel,'' musical comedy based on the fairytale; by Running Rabbit Family Theater. Thursday through Feb. 4. $14. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400.
MUSIC AND DANCE

East Rutherford ''Dancing With the Stars: The Tour,'' with contestants from the reality-television show. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $48.50 to $58.50. Toby Keith, country, with Miranda Lambert. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $27 to $68. Continental Airlines Arena, 50 Route 120. (201) 507-8900. Elmer Matt Duke, singer-songwriter. Friday at 8 p.m. $7. Appel Farm Arts and Music Center, 457 Shirley Road. (800) 394-1211. Englewood Gato Barbieri, jazz saxophonist. Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. $25 to $60. Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 North Van Brunt Street. (201) 227-1030. Glassboro ''Flute and Flutists of Myth and Legend,'' concert and lecture by Adeline Tomasone. Monday at 8 p.m. Free. Rowan University, Wilson Hall, Route 322. (856) 256-4545. Morristown The Colonial Symphony, with Serena McKinney, violinist; with a preconcert lecture at 7 p.m. Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. $25 to $45. Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. Mount Laurel William Smith, folk. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Borders Books and Music, 4010 Dearborn Circle. (856) 866-9090. New Brunswick ''The Merry Widow,'' operetta by Franz Lehar; in German with English supertitles. Through Feb. 4. $15 to $25. Nicholas Music Center, Rutgers University, 85 George Street. (732) 932-7511. Princeton DanceBrazil; music, dance and capoeira. Tuesday at 8 p.m. $37 to $40. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Summit Festival of Summit organists. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. Donation. Calvary Episcopal Church, 31 Woodland Avenue. (908) 277-1547. Summit Benjamin Britten's Canticle III, ''Still Falls the Rain,'' and other works; Irwin Resse, tenor with the Metropolitan Opera, and others; presented by Afternoon Music. Jan. 28 at 4 p.m. $15 and $20. Unitarian Church in Summit, 4 Waldron Avenue. (908) 273-3245. Teaneck Luminescent Orchestrii, folk. Feb. 3 at 8 p.m. $10. ''On the Rise: Concert Artists on the Horizon,'' piano series: Beatrice Long; multimedia presentation. Feb. 4 at 4 p.m. $12 and $15. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923.
SPOKEN WORD

East Brunswick Aisha Bain, author and filmmaker. A screening of her documentary, ''Darfur Diaries: Message From Home,'' follows at 7 p.m. at the adjacent Mega Movies. Jan. 28 at 5 p.m. Free; donation for film screening. Barnes & Noble, 753 Route 18. (732) 432-0100. Toms River ''Meet the Filmmaker,'' with Melinka Thompson-Godoy, producer of the documentary ''The Town That Was.'' Feb. 4 at 2 p.m. Free. Ocean County Library, 101 Washington Street. (732) 349-6200.
THEATER

Cinnaminson ''The Nerd,'' comedy by Larry Shue. Through Feb. 3. $15. The Playhouse, 808 Pomona Road. (856) 829-7144. Lawrenceville Kaleidoscope Chamber Orchestra; works by Bach, Mozart and others; presented by Westminster Conservatory. Sunday at 3 p.m. $5 and $10. Gill Chapel, Rider University, 2083 Lawrence Road. (609) 921-2663. Leonia ''The Trip to Bountiful,'' drama by Horton Foote; the Players' Guild of Leonia. Through Feb. 11. $16 and $18. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue. (201) 947-9606. Long Branch ''October 1962,'' drama by D. W. Gregory. Through Jan. 28. $25 to $40. New Jersey Repertory Company, 179 Broadway. (732) 229-3166. Marlboro ''The King and I,'' musical by Rogers and Hammerstein; by Marlboro Players. Through Jan. 28. $14 to $18. Marlboro Middle School, Route 520 (between Wyncrest and Gordons Corner Roads). (732) 972-7217. Millburn ''Summer and Smoke,'' drama by Tennessee Williams, with Amanda Plummer and Kevin Anderson. Through Feb. 11. $19 to $68. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. MorrisTown ''Hot 'N' Cole,'' a musical revue of the work of Cole Porter. Through Feb. 18. $15 to $35. Bickford Theater, 6 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 971-3706. New Brunswick ''I Am My Own Wife,'' one-man play by Doug Wright, with Mark Nelson. Through Feb. 11. $28 to $62. George Street Playhouse, 9 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7717. New Brunswick ''The Country Wife,'' comedy by William Wycherley, presented by the Rutgers Theater Company. Friday through Feb. 17. $15 to $25. New Theater, Mason Gross Performing Arts Center, Douglass Campus, Rutgers University, 85 George Street. (732) 932-7511. Newark ''Hairspray,'' musical comedy. Tuesday through Feb. 4. $20 to $58. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Nutley ''Measure for Measure,'' Shakespeare's comedy. Friday through Feb. 17. $12. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Oaklyn ''Purlie,'' musical by Gary Geld, Ossie Davis, Peter Udell and Philip Rose. Through Feb. 10. $17 to $30. Ritz Theater, 915 Whitehorse Pike. (856) 858-5230. Oradell ''Brooklyn Boy,'' comedy by David Margulies; Bergen County Players. Through Feb. 3. $15 and $18. Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road. (201) 261-4200. Princeton PlayLab Series: ''Kit Marlowe,'' staged reading of David Grimm's drama; presented by the Princeton Rep Company. Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. Free. Princeton Public Library, 65 Witherspoon Street. (609) 924-9529. Red Bank ''The Pavilion,'' by Craig Wright. Through Feb. 4. $30 to $54. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400. West Windsor ''James and the Giant Peach,'' adapted from Roald Dahl's book; the Pennington Players. Through Jan. 28. $8 and $10. Kelsey Theater, West Windsor Campus, Mercer County Community College, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 570-3333.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Asbury Park ''Winter and Other Seasonal Moments,'' photographs and paintings, group show. Through Feb. 25. Apex Gallery, 611 Cookman Avenue. (732) 776-7746. Cape May ''Small Towns, Black Lives: African-American Communities in New Jersey,'' photography by Wendel A. White. Through May 13. $1 and $2. Mid-Atlantic Center for the Arts, 1048 Washington Street. (609) 884-5404. Hamilton ''New Jersey Perspective,'' photography by Owen Kanzler and sculpture by Kate Graves. Through April 8. $1 to $12; members free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m., April through October; 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., November through March. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Highland Park ''Graffiti Series,'' mixed-media by Katja Valeur. Through Wednesday. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Highland Park Public Library, 31 North Fifth Avenue. (732) 572-2750. Hopewell ''Mongolia: Where Kazakhs Hunt With Eagles,'' photography by David H. Miller. Through Feb. 4. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Lincroft African-American stamp art from the collection of Wanda Garbett. Through Feb. 18. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Newark ''Landscape Revisited: Fact and Metaphor,'' group show. Thursday through Mar. 29. Reception: Thursday, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. City Without Walls, 6 Crawford Street. (973) 622-1188. Newark ''Portraits of Science Explorers by Mary Alice Copp.'' Through Feb. 18. $3 to $7; members, free. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6550. Newark ''Night of the Khmer Rouge: Genocide and Justice in Cambodia,'' photographic documents, film and records. Through Feb. 22. Paul Robeson Campus Center, Rutgers University - Newark Campus, 350 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard. (973) 353-5300. Newton ''Contemporary Burmese Art,'' presented by ArtAsiaNYC. Through March 9. Sussex County Community College Art Gallery, 1 College Hill Road. (973) 300-2329. Oceanville ''Emerging Artists Exhibition: Spinning Worlds,'' works by Paul Santoleri and Carla Falb. ''Surface Rhythms,'' works by Bennett Bean and Barbara Bullock. Both through April 22. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. Plainfield ''Intimate Images,'' mixed-media show by Salomon Kadoche. Through Wednesday. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Swain Galleries, 703 Watchung Avenue. (908) 756-1707. Princeton ''Rage, Terror, Flowers and Sunsets,'' abstract paintings by Jim Fuess. Through Feb. 16. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 2:30 to 9 p.m. Erdman Gallery at the Princeton Theological Seminary, 20 Library Place. (609) 497-7990. Rahway ''The Naked Truth: Quilted and Sewn Figurative Works and Nudes,'' traditional quilting techniques. Through Feb. 9. Hours: Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 3 p.m. and 5 to 7 p.m. Arts Guild of Rahway, 1670 Irving Street. (732) 381-7511. Summit Art Upstairs Gallery exhibition, works by the Community Theater's Art Upstairs Gallery. Through Feb. 10. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Visual Arts Center of New Jersey, 68 Elm Street. (908) 273-9121. Upper Montclair ''Modern Polish Masters,'' group show. Through Feb. 28. J. K. K. Fine Arts, 594 Valley Road. (973) 744-0111. West Long Branch ''Objects of Divine Hatred: Remix Version 1.0,'' mixed-media. Through March 16. ''Derek Boshier: Extreme Makeover,'' mixed-media. Through March 23. Hours: Mondays through Wednesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. 800 and Ice House Galleries, Monmouth University, 400 Cedar Avenue. (732) 571-3512.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
